Description: Conical foot sherd of large Chian pottery chalice; white slip; exterior glazed (fired red and very worn).
Curator's comments: The diameter of the foot suggests that it belonged to a very large chalice. Large chalices are typically found as early as the patterned and Wild Goat Style in circa 630BC and last until the end of the Grand Style in circa 570BC.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0362) (phase 2)
